text: Lubomyr Husar MSU (Liubomyr Huzar; 26 February 1933 – 31 May 2017) was the major archbishop of the Ukrainian Catholic Church, a minority church in Ukraine but the largest sui juris Eastern church in full communion with the Holy See. Husar was also a Cardinal of the Catholic Church. After the transfer of the see of Lviv to Kyiv in 2005, he was the Ukrainian Catholic Major Archbishop of Kyiv-Galicia. In February 2011 he became Major Archeparch Emeritus after he resigned due to ill health. Husar died on 31 May 2017 following a long-illness in Kniazhychi, Kyiv Oblast, Ukraine at the age of 84.Помер Любомир Гузар ==References== ==Other websites== * Cardinalrating pages concerning him * An interview published in February 2004 by Zerkalo Nedeli (Mirror Weekly), Kyiv, in Ukrainian and in Russian. * Biography at Catholic-pages.com * Biography at Catholic-hierarchy.com Category:1933 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Archbishops Category:Eastern Catholic bishops Category:Cardinals of the Roman Catholic Church Category:Ukrainian Christian clergy Category:People from Lviv
title: Lubomyr Husar
